thread.title: Pop-Tarts are being made into pizza, tacos and nachos. No, really.
thread.title_full: Pop-Tarts are being made into pizza, tacos and nachos. No, really.

author: Christine Wang
title: Pop-Tarts are being made into pizza, tacos and nachos. No, really.
text:
Sometimes, it feels like the entire food industry's only desire is to create the next edible thing that will make us go WTF.
SEE ALSO: Spice up your life with insane flaming hot Cheeto bagels
Case in point: Kellogg's NYC , a cafe where you can have the honor of paying $6 for a single bowl of cereal, will be overhauling its menu this week to celebrate Pop-Tarts.
Pop-Tarts milkshakes, burritos, and pizza? Yes. This is happening. Pop-Tarts Caf√© is taking over @kelloggsnyc Times Square this week! #PopTartsCafe
A post shared by Pop-Tarts (@poptartsus) on Feb 21, 2017 at 6:59am PST
"You've never tasted anything like it," their website boasts.
Very accurate, as we've never thought about making nachos out of Confetti Cupcake Pop-Tarts or creating a pizza with Brown Sugar Cinnamon Pop-Tarts as the base.
ok this isn't a #misterkrisp but it's a pizza made of @poptartsus and (if you can't tell) I have a soft spot for pizzas made of breakfast foods. seriously magical morning today at the #poptartscafe pop-up at @kelloggsnyc!
A post shared by misterkrisp üíÅüèº jessica siskin (@mister_krisp) on Feb 21, 2017 at 6:36am PST
@KelloggsNYC Times Square is a POP-TART cafe until Sunday. Got my birthday cake nachos, cookies n' creme tacos, chocolate chip loaded fries, + brown sugar cinnamon pizza. #nyc üéâüéÇüç∞üç´
A post shared by THE SWEET LIFE OF LINA üéà (@thesweetlifeoflina) on Feb 21, 2017 at 10:10am PST
But now these things exist in the world, for better or worse.
Pop-Tart creations like the pizza and the tacos run for $8 or $9. The Pop-Tart burrito is the most expensive of the food items on the menu at $12.
This Pop-Tarts burrito (yes, burrito üåØ) is called the Nutty Caramel Banana. It's a chopped up Chocolatey Caramel Pop-Tarts wrapped inside a sweet cr√™pe "tortilla" with fresh banana, toasted pecans & salted caramel sauce. There's also "sour cream" frosting, kiwi salsa verde & strawberry salsa‚Äî& I'm now wondering why all burritos aren't sweet burritos. ü§î Available this week only at #PopTartsCafe in Times Square! #eatstagramnyc #crispyeats
A post shared by Eatstagram NYC (@eatstagram.nyc) on Feb 21, 2017 at 7:23am PST
For those who love Pop-Tarts but want to stay as far away as possible from these weird food mashups, there are more normal items on the menu that make sense for Pop-Tarts.
There are six different kinds of Pop-Tart milkshakes that you can choose from for $12. There is also Pop-Tart tiramisu and cheesecake for $8.
Checkin out the new Kellogg's pop tart cafe in NYC! #poptartscafe #nyc #yum #poptarts #breakfast #dessert #sogood #cookiedough #chocolate #shake
A post shared by NYeaters (@nyeaters) on Feb 21, 2017 at 8:23am PST
POP TART POP UP CAFE. Childhood dreamz. @poptartsus #PopTartsCafe on Broadway in Times Square between 48th & 49th today thru Feb 26! #spicysistersnyc #foodie #nyc ats #nyceats #feedyoursoull #ilyfoodgram #buzzfeast #putaforkinit #foodporn # ats #cheatdayeats
A post shared by SpicySisters NYC (@spicysistersnyc) on Feb 21, 2017 at 10:27am PST
Whether you are an adventurous foodie, a thrill seeker or just want to relive your childhood in the most delicious way possible, Kellogg's NYC is the place for you this week. The Pop-Tarts cafe will operate only until Sunday.
BONUS: Watch this cinnamon roll mastermind turn donuts into heavenly pastries
